intro: Saurauia bifida, commonly known as the splitleaf saurauia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are distinctive for their deeply lobed shape, often splitting into two or more parts. Saurauia bifida produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat.
